text: Well, they’re the absolutely fundamental notions that you seem to need in describing the world: cause, property, relation, number, quantity, notions like this; the sort of thing that makes many people who don’t like philosophy, find it turns them off. But that’s the sort of thing that philosophers have traditionally talked about when they try to describe their view of the fundamental nature of reality, they wanted to place these things in an order and that’s exactly what Anderson did.
